常用导数公式与规则

Commonly Used Derivatives

Basic Rules

  1. Constant Rule:
    ddx[c]=0\frac{d}{dx}[c] = 0dxd​[c]=0
    (The derivative of a constant is always 0.)

  2. Power Rule:
    ddx[xn]=n⋅xn−1\frac{d}{dx}[x^n] = n \cdot x^{n-1}dxd​[xn]=n⋅xn−1

  3. Sum/Difference Rule:
    ddx[f(x)±g(x)]=f′(x)±g′(x)\frac{d}{dx}[f(x) \pm g(x)] = f'(x) \pm g'(x)dxd​[f(x)±g(x)]=f′(x)±g′(x)

  4. Constant Multiple Rule:
    ddx[c⋅f(x)]=c⋅f′(x)\frac{d}{dx}[c \cdot f(x)] = c \cdot f'(x)dxd​[c⋅f(x)]=c⋅f′(x)

Product and Quotient Rules

  1. Product Rule:
    ddx[f(x)⋅g(x)]=f′(x)⋅g(x)+f(x)⋅g′(x)\frac{d}{dx}[f(x) \cdot g(x)] = f'(x) \cdot g(x) + f(x) \cdot g'(x)dxd​[f(x)⋅g(x)]=f′(x)⋅g(x)+f(x)⋅g′(x)

  2. Quotient Rule:
    ddx[f(x)g(x)]=f′(x)⋅g(x)−f(x)⋅g′(x)g(x)2(g(x)≠0)\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f(x)}{g(x)}\right] = \frac{f'(x) \cdot g(x) - f(x) \cdot g'(x)}{g(x)^2} \quad (g(x) \neq 0)dxd​[g(x)f(x)​]=g(x)2f′(x)⋅g(x)−f(x)⋅g′(x)​(g(x)=0)

指数与对数函数

  1. 自然指数函数：
    ddx[ex]=ex\frac{d}{dx}[e^x] = e^xdxd​[ex]=ex

  2. 一般指数函数：
    ddx[ax]=axln⁡(a)(a>0,a≠1)\frac{d}{dx}[a^x] = a^x \ln(a) \quad (a > 0, a \neq 1)dxd​[ax]=axln(a)(a>0,a=1)

  3. 自然对数函数：
    ddx[ln⁡(x)]=1x(x>0)\frac{d}{dx}[\ln(x)] = \frac{1}{x} \quad (x > 0)dxd​[ln(x)]=x1​(x>0)

  4. 一般对数函数：
    ddx[log⁡a(x)]=1xln⁡(a)(x>0,a>0,a≠1)\frac{d}{dx}[\log_a(x)] = \frac{1}{x \ln(a)} \quad (x > 0, a > 0, a \neq 1)dxd​[loga​(x)]=xln(a)1​(x>0,a>0,a=1)

Trigonometric Functions

  1. ddx[sin⁡(x)]=cos⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\sin(x)] = \cos(x)dxd​[sin(x)]=cos(x)

  2. ddx[cos⁡(x)]=−sin⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\cos(x)] = -\sin(x)dxd​[cos(x)]=−sin(x)

  3. ddx[tan⁡(x)]=sec⁡2(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\tan(x)] = \sec^2(x)dxd​[tan(x)]=sec2(x)

  4. ddx[cot⁡(x)]=−csc⁡2(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\cot(x)] = -\csc^2(x)dxd​[cot(x)]=−csc2(x)

  5. ddx[sec⁡(x)]=sec⁡(x)tan⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\sec(x)] = \sec(x) \tan(x)dxd​[sec(x)]=sec(x)tan(x)

  6. ddx[csc⁡(x)]=−csc⁡(x)cot⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\csc(x)] = -\csc(x) \cot(x)dxd​[csc(x)]=−csc(x)cot(x)

Exponential and Logarithmic Functions

  1. ddx[ex]=ex\frac{d}{dx}[e^x] = e^xdxd​[ex]=ex

  2. ddx[ax]=axln⁡(a)(a>0,a≠1)\frac{d}{dx}[a^x] = a^x \ln(a) \quad (a > 0, a \neq 1)dxd​[ax]=axln(a)(a>0,a=1)

  3. ddx[ln⁡(x)]=1x(x>0)\frac{d}{dx}[\ln(x)] = \frac{1}{x} \quad (x > 0)dxd​[ln(x)]=x1​(x>0)

  4. ddx[log⁡a(x)]=1xln⁡(a)(x>0,a>0,a≠1)\frac{d}{dx}[\log_a(x)] = \frac{1}{x \ln(a)} \quad (x > 0, a > 0, a \neq 1)dxd​[loga​(x)]=xln(a)1​(x>0,a>0,a=1)

Inverse Trigonometric Functions

  1. ddx[arcsin⁡(x)]=11−x2(∣x∣<1)\frac{d}{dx}[\arcsin(x)] = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - x^2}} \quad (|x| < 1)dxd​[arcsin(x)]=1−x2​1​(∣x∣<1)

  2. ddx[arccos⁡(x)]=−11−x2(∣x∣<1)\frac{d}{dx}[\arccos(x)] = -\frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - x^2}} \quad (|x| < 1)dxd​[arccos(x)]=−1−x2​1​(∣x∣<1)

  3. ddx[arctan⁡(x)]=11+x2\frac{d}{dx}[\arctan(x)] = \frac{1}{1 + x^2}dxd​[arctan(x)]=1+x21​

Hyperbolic Functions

  1. ddx[sinh⁡(x)]=cosh⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\sinh(x)] = \cosh(x)dxd​[sinh(x)]=cosh(x)

  2. ddx[cosh⁡(x)]=sinh⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\cosh(x)] = \sinh(x)dxd​[cosh(x)]=sinh(x)

  3. ddx[tanh⁡(x)]=sech2(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\tanh(x)] = \text{sech}^2(x)dxd​[tanh(x)]=sech2(x)

  4. ddx[coth⁡(x)]=−csch2(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\coth(x)] = -\text{csch}^2(x)dxd​[coth(x)]=−csch2(x)

  5. ddx[sech(x)]=−sech(x)tanh⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\text{sech}(x)] = -\text{sech}(x) \tanh(x)dxd​[sech(x)]=−sech(x)tanh(x)

  6. ddx[csch(x)]=−csch(x)coth⁡(x)\frac{d}{dx}[\text{csch}(x)] = -\text{csch}(x) \coth(x)dxd​[csch(x)]=−csch(x)coth(x)

Product and Quotient Rules

  1. Product Rule:
    ddx[f(x)⋅g(x)]=f′(x)⋅g(x)+f(x)⋅g′(x)\frac{d}{dx}[f(x) \cdot g(x)] = f'(x) \cdot g(x) + f(x) \cdot g'(x)dxd​[f(x)⋅g(x)]=f′(x)⋅g(x)+f(x)⋅g′(x)

  2. Quotient Rule:
    ddx[f(x)g(x)]=f′(x)⋅g(x)−f(x)⋅g′(x)g(x)2(g(x)≠0)\frac{d}{dx}\left[\frac{f(x)}{g(x)}\right] = \frac{f'(x) \cdot g(x) - f(x) \cdot g'(x)}{g(x)^2} \quad (g(x) \neq 0)dxd​[g(x)f(x)​]=g(x)2f′(x)⋅g(x)−f(x)⋅g′(x)​(g(x)=0)

Chain Rule

  1. General Chain Rule:
    ddx[f(g(x))]=f′(g(x))⋅g′(x)\frac{d}{dx}[f(g(x))] = f'(g(x)) \cdot g'(x)dxd​[f(g(x))]=f′(g(x))⋅g′(x)

1. Functions and Optimization

1.1 Review of concepts

Key Concepts:

  1. Definition of a Function:

    • A function is a relationship where an input xxx is mapped to an output yyy, written as y=f(x)y = f(x)y=f(x).
    • The notation f:RD→Rf: \mathbb{R}^D \to \mathbb{R}f:RD→R means:
      • fff is a function.
      • It takes an input xxx from a domain (here, RD\mathbb{R}^DRD, meaning a real vector space of DDD-dimensions).
      • It produces an output in R\mathbb{R}R (a real number).

  2. Key Properties of Functions:

    • Every input xxx corresponds to only one output yyy.
      • This is the defining property of a function: for each value of xxx, there is only one value of yyy.
    • Independent and Dependent Variables:
      • xxx is the independent variable because it is the input to the function.
      • yyy is the dependent variable because its value depends on xxx.

  3. Example:

    • The example provided is about distance traveled per hour (yyy) as a function of velocity (xxx).
      • For a given velocity xxx, the distance traveled (yyy) is uniquely determined.

  4. Inputs and Outputs:

    • The diagram at the bottom of the page illustrates the process:
      • Input xxx: The value or object you provide to the function.
      • Function fff: The rule or process that transforms the input into an output.
      • Output yyy: The result of applying the function to the input.

  5. Extended Concept:

    • The thought bubble on the top right explains that the input xxx can be more than just a simple number:
      • xxx can be vectors (e.g., a list of numbers) or even matrices (e.g., a grid of numbers).
      • Similarly, the output f(x)f(x)f(x) can also be vectors or matrices, depending on the function.

1.2 Optimization

Optimization of a Function

The slide provides an overview of the concept of function optimization, explaining its mathematical basis and an example of its application in everyday life.

1.2.1 Key Points:

  1. Definition of Function Optimization:

    • A function f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x) is defined, where the vector x\mathbf{x}x represents a set of variables x1,x2,…,xnx_1, x_2, \dots, x_nx1​,x2​,…,xn​.
    • Optimization refers to finding the best x\mathbf{x}x that either:
      • Maximizes f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x), or
      • Minimizes f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x).
    • Mathematically, this is expressed as:
      f(x)=f(x1,x2,…,xn)f(\mathbf{x}) = f(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n)f(x)=f(x1​,x2​,…,xn​)

  2. Example of an Optimization Problem in Real Life:

    • Scenario:
      • You have selected 3 classes for the semester.
      • Each class has a different effect on your GPA.
      • The goal is to maximize your GPA (the value of the function) by determining the optimal number of hours (the function variables) to spend on each class.
    • This involves using prior knowledge of how the number of hours impacts the GPA to find the best allocation of time.

1.2.2 Convex Function and Optimization

This slide introduces the concept of convex functions and their significance in optimization problems. It explains the properties of convex functions and their role in simplifying optimization tasks.

1. Convex Function

  • Definition:

    • A function f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x) is convex if, for any two points x1\mathbf{x}_1x1​ and x2\mathbf{x}_2x2​, and for any θ\thetaθ such that 0≤θ≤10 \leq \theta \leq 10≤θ≤1, the following inequality holds:
      f(θx1+(1−θ)x2)≤θf(x1)+(1−θ)f(x2)f(\theta \mathbf{x}_1 + (1 - \theta) \mathbf{x}_2) \leq \theta f(\mathbf{x}_1) + (1 - \theta) f(\mathbf{x}_2)f(θx1​+(1−θ)x2​)≤θf(x1​)+(1−θ)f(x2​)
    • 函数图像在任意两个点之间的连线（权重平均值）始终在函数曲线的上方或与其重合。
    • This means that the value of the function at any point on the line segment between x1\mathbf{x}_1x1​ and x2\mathbf{x}_2x2​ is less than or equal to the weighted average of the function values at x1\mathbf{x}_1x1​ and x2\mathbf{x}_2x2​.

  • Key Property:

    • A convex function has a "valley-like" shape, meaning it curves upwards and does not have multiple valleys or peaks.
2. Convex Optimization

  • Definition:

    • Convex optimization involves minimizing or maximizing a convex function f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x).

  • Key Property:

    • If f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x) is convex, then:
      • Every local minimum is also a global minimum.
      • Convex functions have the property that any local minimum is a global minimum (last year mid term tested)
    • This property makes optimization of convex functions significantly easier, as finding any local minimum guarantees the global minimum.
    • Local vs Global Optimization
      • Local optimization involves finding the best solution (local maximum or local minimum) within a specific region of the function's domain.
      • Global optimization involves finding the absolute best solution (global maximum or global minimum) for a function over its entire domain.

  • Importance:

    • Convex optimization is widely used in machine learning, economics, and engineering because it ensures efficient and reliable solutions.

1.2.2 Concave Function and Optimization

Concave Function

A function f(x)f(x)f(x) is concave if, for any x1,x2∈domain of fx_1, x_2 \in \text{domain of } fx1​,x2​∈domain of f, and θ∈[0,1]\theta \in [0, 1]θ∈[0,1], the following inequality holds:

f(θx1+(1−θ)x2)≥θf(x1)+(1−θ)f(x2)f(\theta x_1 + (1 - \theta)x_2) \geq \theta f(x_1) + (1 - \theta)f(x_2)f(θx1​+(1−θ)x2​)≥θf(x1​)+(1−θ)f(x2​)

This means that the function lies above or on the line segment connecting any two points on the graph of the function. Geometrically, the graph of a concave function appears "arched downward."

Concave Optimization

If f(x)f(x)f(x) is a concave function, then:

  • Every local maximum is also a global maximum.

This is because a concave function has a single "peak" (or a flat region) and no other local maxima, making any local maximum also the global maximum.

2. Function Derivatives

2.1 Derivative of Univariate Functions 单变量

What are Derivatives?

The derivative of f(x)f(x)f(x) is the slope of the tangent line (instantaneous rate of change) at (x,f(x))(x, f(x))(x,f(x)).

dydx=f′(x)=lim⁡Δx→0f(x+Δx)−f(x)Δx\frac{dy}{dx} = f'(x) = \lim_{\Delta x \to 0} \frac{f(x + \Delta x) - f(x)}{\Delta x}dxdy​=f′(x)=Δx→0lim​Δxf(x+Δx)−f(x)​

The process of calculating the derivatives of a function is called differentiation.

Example: y=x2y = x^2y=x2

dydx=lim⁡Δx→0(x+Δx)2−x2Δx\frac{dy}{dx} = \lim_{\Delta x \to 0} \frac{(x + \Delta x)^2 - x^2}{\Delta x}dxdy​=Δx→0lim​Δx(x+Δx)2−x2​

Differential Form:

The derivative can also be written as:
dy=2x dxdy = 2x \, dxdy=2xdx

  • Here, dydydy is the differential (a small change in yyy) in terms of dxdxdx (a small change in xxx).
Applications:
  • The differential form dy=2x dxdy = 2x \, dxdy=2xdx can be used to estimate the output difference Δy\Delta yΔy in terms of a small input difference Δx\Delta xΔx.

2.2 Partial Derivative and Gradient

2.2.1 梯度

定义：

梯度是一个向量，包含了函数对所有输入变量的偏导数。它将这些偏导数收集到一个行向量中。

∇xf=dfdx=[∂f(x)∂x1⋯∂f(x)∂xn]\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f = \frac{df}{d\mathbf{x}} = \begin{bmatrix} \frac{\partial f(x)}{\partial x_1} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f(x)}{\partial x_n} \end{bmatrix}∇x​f=dxdf​=[∂x1​∂f(x)​​⋯​∂xn​∂f(x)​​]

  • 梯度是一个 1×n1 \times n1×n 的行向量，表示函数 f(x)f(x)f(x) 在每个输入方向上的变化率。
关键点：
  • 梯度的作用是描述函数 f(x)f(x)f(x) 在输入空间（Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn）中的变化方向和速率。
  • 梯度向量的方向是函数增加最快的方向，向量的大小表示增加的速率。

2.2.2 求偏导的计算规则

1. 偏导数的规则适用性

  • PPT顶部的蓝色气泡中写道：

    “Many of the univariate function’s derivative rules hold for partial differentiation”

    • 意思是：单变量函数的许多求导规则（如加法法则、乘法法则、商法则、链式法则和幂法则）同样适用于偏导数的计算。

  • 右侧蓝框补充：

    “These include the sum rule, product rule, quotient rule, chain rule, and power rule.”

    • 这些规则包括：加法法则、乘法法则、商法则、链式法则以及幂法则。
2. 偏导数的规则
(1) 乘法法则（Product Rule）

∂∂x(f(x)g(x))=∂f∂xg(x)+f(x)∂g∂x\frac{\partial}{\partial x} \big(f(x) g(x)\big) = \frac{\partial f}{\partial x} g(x) + f(x) \frac{\partial g}{\partial x}∂x∂​(f(x)g(x))=∂x∂f​g(x)+f(x)∂x∂g​

  • 解释：
    • 对两个函数 f(x)f(x)f(x) 和 g(x)g(x)g(x) 的乘积求偏导时，结果是：
      1. f(x)f(x)f(x) 的偏导乘以 g(x)g(x)g(x) 本身；
      2. 加上 f(x)f(x)f(x) 本身乘以 g(x)g(x)g(x) 的偏导。
(2) 加法法则（Sum Rule）

∂∂x(f(x)+g(x))=∂f∂x+∂g∂x\frac{\partial}{\partial x} \big(f(x) + g(x)\big) = \frac{\partial f}{\partial x} + \frac{\partial g}{\partial x}∂x∂​(f(x)+g(x))=∂x∂f​+∂x∂g​

  • 解释：
    • 对两个函数之和求偏导时，结果是每个函数分别求偏导后相加。
(3) 链式法则（Chain Rule）

∂∂xg(f(x))=∂g∂f⋅∂f∂x\frac{\partial}{\partial x} g\big(f(x)\big) = \frac{\partial g}{\partial f} \cdot \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}∂x∂​g(f(x))=∂f∂g​⋅∂x∂f​

  • 解释：
    • 如果 ggg 是 f(x)f(x)f(x) 的函数（即复合函数），那么对 g(f(x))g(f(x))g(f(x)) 求偏导时：
      1. 首先对 ggg 相对于 fff 求偏导；
      2. 然后乘以 fff 相对于 xxx 的偏导。

2.2.3 线性代数和函数

1. Jacobian Matrix

This slide provides a review of the Jacobian matrix for vector-valued functions. It explains the mathematical structure and meaning of the Jacobian matrix, particularly in the context of functions that map from Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn to Rm\mathbb{R}^mRm. Here's a breakdown of its content:

Jacobian Matrix Definition

  • The Jacobian matrix, denoted as J\mathbf{J}J or ∇xf\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f∇x​f, represents the derivative of a vector-valued function f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x) with respect to the input vector x\mathbf{x}x.

J=∇xf=df(x)dx\mathbf{J} = \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f = \frac{\mathrm{d}f(\mathbf{x})}{\mathrm{d}\mathbf{x}}J=∇x​f=dxdf(x)​

  • The Jacobian is a matrix where:
    • Rows correspond to the partial derivatives of each output component (entries of f(x)\mathbf{f}(\mathbf{x})f(x)).
    • Columns correspond to the partial derivatives with respect to each input variable (entries of x\mathbf{x}x).

Structure of the Jacobian Matrix
The Jacobian matrix is written as:

J=(∂f1∂x1∂f1∂x2⋯∂f1∂xn∂f2∂x1∂f2∂x2⋯∂f2∂xn⋮⋮⋱⋮∂fm∂x1∂fm∂x2⋯∂fm∂xn)\mathbf{J} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial f_1}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial f_1}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f_1}{\partial x_n} \\ \frac{\partial f_2}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial f_2}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f_2}{\partial x_n} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial f_m}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial f_m}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f_m}{\partial x_n} \end{pmatrix}J=​∂x1​∂f1​​∂x1​∂f2​​⋮∂x1​∂fm​​​∂x2​∂f1​​∂x2​∂f2​​⋮∂x2​∂fm​​​⋯⋯⋱⋯​∂xn​∂f1​​∂xn​∂f2​​⋮∂xn​∂fm​​​​

  • Rows: Each row corresponds to one output function fi(x)f_i(\mathbf{x})fi​(x), showing how it changes with respect to each input variable x1,x2,…,xnx_1, x_2, \dots, x_nx1​,x2​,…,xn​.
  • Columns: Each column corresponds to one input variable xjx_jxj​, showing how all output components f1,f2,…,fmf_1, f_2, \dots, f_mf1​,f2​,…,fm​ change with respect to xjx_jxj​.

Dimensions of the Jacobian

  • For a function f:Rn→Rmf: \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^mf:Rn→Rm:
    • The input is an nnn-dimensional vector (x∈Rn\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^nx∈Rn).
    • The output is an mmm-dimensional vector (f(x)∈Rm\mathbf{f}(\mathbf{x}) \in \mathbb{R}^mf(x)∈Rm).
    • Therefore, the Jacobian matrix J\mathbf{J}J has dimensions of m×nm \times nm×n:
      • mmm rows (one for each output component).
      • nnn columns (one for each input variable).

Notation and Interpretation

  • The Jacobian matrix is often represented as:

J=(∂f1∂x1⋯∂f1∂xn⋮⋱⋮∂fm∂x1⋯∂fm∂xn)\mathbf{J} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial f_1}{\partial x_1} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f_1}{\partial x_n} \\ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial f_m}{\partial x_1} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f_m}{\partial x_n} \end{pmatrix}J=​∂x1​∂f1​​⋮∂x1​∂fm​​​⋯⋱⋯​∂xn​∂f1​​⋮∂xn​∂fm​​​​

  • Key insight:
    • Each row focuses on a specific output fi(x)f_i(\mathbf{x})fi​(x), showing how it changes with all input variables.
    • Each column focuses on a specific input variable xjx_jxj​, showing how all outputs f1,f2,…,fmf_1, f_2, \dots, f_mf1​,f2​,…,fm​ change with respect to xjx_jxj​.
2. Two kinds of Jacobian Matrix

两种布局的区别

布局形式 分子布局 (Numerator-Layout) 分母布局 (Denominator-Layout)
定义方式 输出变量的数量 × 输入变量的数量 输入变量的数量 × 输出变量的数量
Jacobian 矩阵维度 RN×M\mathbb{R}^{N \times M}RN×M：矩阵是“高而瘦”的 RM×N\mathbb{R}^{M \times N}RM×N：矩阵是“矮而胖”的
适用场景 更常见于数学分析或机器学习中，尤其是梯度计算 常用于物理学或工程学中，尤其是优化问题
形象比喻 一只高而瘦的长颈鹿 一只矮而胖的长颈鹿

公式对比
假设函数为 y=f(x)\mathbf{y} = f(\mathbf{x})y=f(x)，其中：

  • y∈RN\mathbf{y} \in \mathbb{R}^Ny∈RN 是 NNN 维输出向量。
  • x∈RM\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^Mx∈RM 是 MMM 维输入向量。

分子布局 (Numerator-Layout):
∂y∂x=(∂y1∂x1∂y1∂x2⋯∂y1∂xM∂y2∂x1∂y2∂x2⋯∂y2∂xM⋮⋮⋱⋮∂yN∂x1∂yN∂x2⋯∂yN∂xM),维度：N×M\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_M} \\ \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_M} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_M} \end{pmatrix}, \quad \text{维度：} N \times M∂x∂y​=​∂x1​∂y1​​∂x1​∂y2​​⋮∂x1​∂yN​​​∂x2​∂y1​​∂x2​∂y2​​⋮∂x2​∂yN​​​⋯⋯⋱⋯​∂xM​∂y1​​∂xM​∂y2​​⋮∂xM​∂yN​​​​,维度：N×M

  • 行：表示每个输出变量 yiy_iyi​ 对所有输入变量 xjx_jxj​ 的偏导数。
  • 列：表示每个输入变量 xjx_jxj​ 对所有输出变量 yiy_iyi​ 的影响。

分母布局 (Denominator-Layout):
∂y∂x=(∂y1∂x1∂y2∂x1⋯∂yN∂x1∂y1∂x2∂y2∂x2⋯∂yN∂x2⋮⋮⋱⋮∂y1∂xM∂y2∂xM⋯∂yN∂xM),维度：M×N\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_1} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_1} \\ \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_2} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_2} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_M} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_M} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_M} \end{pmatrix}, \quad \text{维度：} M \times N∂x∂y​=​∂x1​∂y1​​∂x2​∂y1​​⋮∂xM​∂y1​​​∂x1​∂y2​​∂x2​∂y2​​⋮∂xM​∂y2​​​⋯⋯⋱⋯​∂x1​∂yN​​∂x2​∂yN​​⋮∂xM​∂yN​​​​,维度：M×N

  • 行：表示每个输入变量 xjx_jxj​ 对所有输出变量 yiy_iyi​ 的偏导数。
  • 列：表示每个输出变量 yiy_iyi​ 对所有输入变量 xjx_jxj​ 的影响。

举例说明
假设我们有一个函数：
y=f(x),y=(y1y2),x=(x1x2x3).\mathbf{y} = f(\mathbf{x}), \quad \mathbf{y} = \begin{pmatrix} y_1 \\ y_2 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{x} = \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \\ x_3 \end{pmatrix}.y=f(x),y=(y1​y2​​),x=​x1​x2​x3​​​.

分子布局 (Numerator-Layout):
  • 输出维度 N=2N = 2N=2，输入维度 M=3M = 3M=3。
  • Jacobian 矩阵为 2×32 \times 32×3：
    ∂y∂x=(∂y1∂x1∂y1∂x2∂y1∂x3∂y2∂x1∂y2∂x2∂y2∂x3).\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_2} & \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_3} \\ \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_2} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_3} \end{pmatrix}.∂x∂y​=(∂x1​∂y1​​∂x1​∂y2​​​∂x2​∂y1​​∂x2​∂y2​​​∂x3​∂y1​​∂x3​∂y2​​​).
分母布局 (Denominator-Layout):
  • 输出维度 N=2N = 2N=2，输入维度 M=3M = 3M=3。
  • Jacobian 矩阵为 3×23 \times 23×2：
    ∂y∂x=(∂y1∂x1∂y2∂x1∂y1∂x2∂y2∂x2∂y1∂x3∂y2∂x3).\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_1} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_1} \\ \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_2} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_2} \\ \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_3} & \frac{\partial y_2}{\partial x_3} \end{pmatrix}.∂x∂y​=​∂x1​∂y1​​∂x2​∂y1​​∂x3​∂y1​​​∂x1​∂y2​​∂x2​∂y2​​∂x3​∂y2​​​​.

总结

  • 分子布局 (Numerator-Layout) 更适合描述输出变量的变化，常用于梯度计算和机器学习。
  • 分母布局 (Denominator-Layout) 更适合描述输入变量的变化，常用于优化问题和工程应用。
  • 两种布局只是表示方式不同，本质上提供的是相同的信息，具体选择取决于应用场景和习惯。

Highlighted Notes

  • Rows are about an entry of output.
    • Each row corresponds to how one specific output component depends on all the input variables.
  • Columns are about an entry of input.
    • Each column corresponds to how all output components depend on one specific input variable.
3. 张量与输入输出
四维张量的形成
a. 向量输出的函数

函数形式为：
y=f(x),\mathbf{y} = f(\mathbf{x}),y=f(x),
其中：

  • 输入：x∈RM\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^Mx∈RM，是一个 MMM 维向量。
  • 输出：y∈RN\mathbf{y} \in \mathbb{R}^Ny∈RN，是一个 NNN 维向量。

如何计算导数？

  • 每个输出变量 yiy_iyi​ 对每个输入变量 xjx_jxj​ 的偏导数 ∂yi∂xj\frac{\partial y_i}{\partial x_j}∂xj​∂yi​​ 构成一个矩阵：
    ∂y∂x=(∂y1∂x1⋯∂y1∂xM⋮⋱⋮∂yN∂x1⋯∂yN∂xM).\frac{\partial \mathbf{y}}{\partial \mathbf{x}} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_1} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_1}{\partial x_M} \\ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_1} & \cdots & \frac{\partial y_N}{\partial x_M} \end{pmatrix}.∂x∂y​=​∂x1​∂y1​​⋮∂x1​∂yN​​​⋯⋱⋯​∂xM​∂y1​​⋮∂xM​∂yN​​​​.
  • 这个矩阵表示 Jacobian 矩阵，维度为 N×MN \times MN×M。

总结：

  • 如果函数的输出是一个向量，导数将形成一个二维矩阵（Jacobian 矩阵）。
b. 矩阵输出的函数

函数形式为：
Y=f(X),\mathbf{Y} = f(\mathbf{X}),Y=f(X),
其中：

  • 输入：X∈RM×L\mathbf{X} \in \mathbb{R}^{M \times L}X∈RM×L，是一个 M×LM \times LM×L 的矩阵。
  • 输出：Y∈RN×K\mathbf{Y} \in \mathbb{R}^{N \times K}Y∈RN×K，是一个 N×KN \times KN×K 的矩阵。

如何计算导数？

  • 每个输出元素 Yi,kY_{i,k}Yi,k​ 对每个输入元素 Xj,lX_{j,l}Xj,l​ 的偏导数 ∂Yi,k∂Xj,l\frac{\partial Y_{i,k}}{\partial X_{j,l}}∂Xj,l​∂Yi,k​​ 构成一个 四维张量：
    ∂Y∂X是一个四维张量，维度为 (N×K×M×L).\frac{\partial \mathbf{Y}}{\partial \mathbf{X}} \quad \text{是一个四维张量，维度为 } (N \times K \times M \times L).∂X∂Y​是一个四维张量，维度为 (N×K×M×L).

总结：

  • 如果函数的输出是一个矩阵，导数将形成一个四维张量。
  • 这种情况下，偏导数的维度比简单的向量输出更高，需要更多结构来表示。
c. 幻灯片内容逐步解析

左侧：向量输出

  • 输入是一个 MMM 维向量，输出是一个 NNN 维向量。
  • 通过计算偏导数 ∂yi∂xj\frac{\partial y_i}{\partial x_j}∂xj​∂yi​​，形成一个 N×MN \times MN×M 的矩阵（Jacobian 矩阵）。

右侧：矩阵输出

  • 输入是一个 M×LM \times LM×L 的矩阵，输出是一个 N×KN \times KN×K 的矩阵。
  • 通过计算偏导数 ∂Yi,k∂Xj,l\frac{\partial Y_{i,k}}{\partial X_{j,l}}∂Xj,l​∂Yi,k​​，形成一个 四维张量。

关键点：

  • Bag of Derivatives：可以将这些偏导数看作是一个“导数集合”，具体的组织形式取决于输入和输出的维度。
  • 四维张量：当输入和输出都是矩阵时，导数的维度升高，形成一个 N×K×M×LN \times K \times M \times LN×K×M×L 的四维结构。
d. 总结
  • 向量输出的函数：导数形成一个二维矩阵（Jacobian 矩阵）。
  • 矩阵输出的函数：导数形成一个四维张量。
  • 这种导数的组织方式在机器学习、优化以及深度学习中非常重要，尤其是在计算梯度时。
4. Matrices and the Chain Rule

The slides explain composite functions involving matrices and how to apply the chain rule to such functions. Below is a detailed breakdown of the content from the slides.

a. Composite Functions

  • A composite function takes a matrix as input, produces another matrix as output, and this output can be the input for another function.
  • Mathematically, a composite function is written as:
    (f∘g)(X)=f(g(X)),(f \circ g)(X) = f(g(X)),(f∘g)(X)=f(g(X)),
    where XXX is a matrix, and fff and ggg are matrix-valued functions.

Example

  • If f(X)=AXf(X) = AXf(X)=AX and g(Y)=YBg(Y) = YBg(Y)=YB, where AAA and BBB are matrices, then:
    (f∘g)(X)=f(g(X))=A(XB).(f \circ g)(X) = f(g(X)) = A(XB).(f∘g)(X)=f(g(X))=A(XB).
    This shows that the composite function applies ggg first (producing XBXBXB), and then applies fff (resulting in A(XB)A(XB)A(XB)).

Matrix Flow
This process can be visualized as:
X→[g]→Y→[f]→Z,X \to [g] \to Y \to [f] \to Z,X→[g]→Y→[f]→Z,
where:

  • XXX is the input matrix.
  • ggg transforms XXX into YYY.
  • fff transforms YYY into ZZZ.

Chain Rule for Matrices
The chain rule for composite functions involving matrices is:
dZdX=dZdY⋅dYdX.\frac{dZ}{dX} = \frac{dZ}{dY} \cdot \frac{dY}{dX}.dXdZ​=dYdZ​⋅dXdY​.

  • Here, matrix multiplication order matters because matrix multiplication is not commutative (i.e., AB≠BAAB \neq BAAB=BA in general).
  • The order of derivatives is crucial to ensure the correct computation of the result.
    Key Point
  • Be careful of the order of operations when applying the chain rule to matrices, as the non-commutativity of matrix multiplication can lead to errors.

Example of the Chain Rule for Vector-Valued Functions

This slide provides a concrete example of using the chain rule for a composite function involving vector-valued functions.

Setup

  • Define a composite function h(t)=(f∘g)(t)=f(g(t))h(t) = (f \circ g)(t) = f(g(t))h(t)=(f∘g)(t)=f(g(t)), where:
    • f:R2→Rf : \mathbb{R}^2 \to \mathbb{R}f:R2→R, f(x1,x2)=exp⁡(x1x2)f(x_1, x_2) = \exp(x_1 x_2)f(x1​,x2​)=exp(x1​x2​),
    • g:R→R2g : \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}^2g:R→R2, g(t)=(tcos⁡(t)tsin⁡(t))g(t) = \begin{pmatrix} t \cos(t) \\ t \sin(t) \end{pmatrix}g(t)=(tcos(t)tsin(t)​).

Notes

  1. The derivative of fff with respect to its input x=(x1,x2)\mathbf{x} = (x_1, x_2)x=(x1​,x2​) is:
    ∂f∂x∈R1×2.\frac{\partial f}{\partial \mathbf{x}} \in \mathbb{R}^{1 \times 2}.∂x∂f​∈R1×2.
  2. The derivative of ggg with respect to ttt is:
    ∂g∂t∈R2×1.\frac{\partial g}{\partial t} \in \mathbb{R}^{2 \times 1}.∂t∂g​∈R2×1.

Using the Chain Rule

To compute dhdt\frac{dh}{dt}dtdh​, we use the chain rule:
dhdt=∂f∂x⋅∂x∂t.\frac{dh}{dt} = \frac{\partial f}{\partial \mathbf{x}} \cdot \frac{\partial \mathbf{x}}{\partial t}.dtdh​=∂x∂f​⋅∂t∂x​.

Breaking it down step by step:

  1. Compute ∂f∂x\frac{\partial f}{\partial \mathbf{x}}∂x∂f​:
    f(x1,x2)=exp⁡(x1x2),∂f∂x1=exp⁡(x1x2)x2,∂f∂x2=exp⁡(x1x2)x1.f(x_1, x_2) = \exp(x_1 x_2), \quad \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_1} = \exp(x_1 x_2) x_2, \quad \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_2} = \exp(x_1 x_2) x_1.f(x1​,x2​)=exp(x1​x2​),∂x1​∂f​=exp(x1​x2​)x2​,∂x2​∂f​=exp(x1​x2​)x1​.
    Therefore:
    ∂f∂x=(exp⁡(x1x2)x2exp⁡(x1x2)x1).\frac{\partial f}{\partial \mathbf{x}} = \begin{pmatrix} \exp(x_1 x_2) x_2 & \exp(x_1 x_2) x_1 \end{pmatrix}.∂x∂f​=(exp(x1​x2​)x2​​exp(x1​x2​)x1​​).

  2. Compute ∂x∂t\frac{\partial \mathbf{x}}{\partial t}∂t∂x​:
    g(t)=(tcos⁡(t)tsin⁡(t)),∂x1∂t=cos⁡(t)−tsin⁡(t),∂x2∂t=sin⁡(t)+tcos⁡(t).g(t) = \begin{pmatrix} t \cos(t) \\ t \sin(t) \end{pmatrix}, \quad \frac{\partial x_1}{\partial t} = \cos(t) - t \sin(t), \quad \frac{\partial x_2}{\partial t} = \sin(t) + t \cos(t).g(t)=(tcos(t)tsin(t)​),∂t∂x1​​=cos(t)−tsin(t),∂t∂x2​​=sin(t)+tcos(t).
    Therefore:
    ∂x∂t=(cos⁡(t)−tsin⁡(t)sin⁡(t)+tcos⁡(t)).\frac{\partial \mathbf{x}}{\partial t} = \begin{pmatrix} \cos(t) - t \sin(t) \\ \sin(t) + t \cos(t) \end{pmatrix}.∂t∂x​=(cos(t)−tsin(t)sin(t)+tcos(t)​).

  3. Multiply the results:
    dhdt=∂f∂x⋅∂x∂t.\frac{dh}{dt} = \frac{\partial f}{\partial \mathbf{x}} \cdot \frac{\partial \mathbf{x}}{\partial t}.dtdh​=∂x∂f​⋅∂t∂x​.
    Substituting:
    dhdt=(exp⁡(x1x2)x2exp⁡(x1x2)x1)⋅(cos⁡(t)−tsin⁡(t)sin⁡(t)+tcos⁡(t)).\frac{dh}{dt} = \begin{pmatrix} \exp(x_1 x_2) x_2 & \exp(x_1 x_2) x_1 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} \cos(t) - t \sin(t) \\ \sin(t) + t \cos(t) \end{pmatrix}.dtdh​=(exp(x1​x2​)x2​​exp(x1​x2​)x1​​)⋅(cos(t)−tsin(t)sin(t)+tcos(t)​).

3. Gradients of Matrices

示例设定

假设 R\mathbf{R}R 是一个 3×33 \times 33×3 的矩阵：
R=[abcdefghi],\mathbf{R} = \begin{bmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{bmatrix},R=​adg​beh​cfi​​,
则 K=R⊤R\mathbf{K} = \mathbf{R}^\top \mathbf{R}K=R⊤R 为：
K=[a2+d2+g2ab+de+ghac+df+giba+ed+hgb2+e2+h2bc+ef+hica+fd+igcb+fe+ihc2+f2+i2].\mathbf{K} = \begin{bmatrix} a^2 + d^2 + g^2 & ab + de + gh & ac + df + gi \\ ba + ed + hg & b^2 + e^2 + h^2 & bc + ef + hi \\ ca + fd + ig & cb + fe + ih & c^2 + f^2 + i^2 \end{bmatrix}.K=​a2+d2+g2ba+ed+hgca+fd+ig​ab+de+ghb2+e2+h2cb+fe+ih​ac+df+gibc+ef+hic2+f2+i2​​.
由于 K\mathbf{K}K 是对称矩阵（Kpq=KqpK_{pq} = K_{qp}Kpq​=Kqp​），我们只需计算部分元素即可。

梯度计算

1. 当 p=1,q=1p=1, q=1p=1,q=1（对角线元素 K11K_{11}K11​）

K11=a2+d2+g2.K_{11} = a^2 + d^2 + g^2.K11​=a2+d2+g2.

  • 对 Ri1R_{i1}Ri1​ 求导（即 j=1j=1j=1，且 p=q=1p=q=1p=q=1）：
    ∂K11∂Ri1=2Ri1⇒{∂K11∂a=2a,∂K11∂d=2d,∂K11∂g=2g.\frac{\partial K_{11}}{\partial R_{i1}} = 2R_{i1} \quad \Rightarrow \quad \begin{cases} \frac{\partial K_{11}}{\partial a} = 2a, \\ \frac{\partial K_{11}}{\partial d} = 2d, \\ \frac{\partial K_{11}}{\partial g} = 2g. \end{cases}∂Ri1​∂K11​​=2Ri1​⇒⎩⎨⎧​∂a∂K11​​=2a,∂d∂K11​​=2d,∂g∂K11​​=2g.​
  • 对其他列（如 j=2,3j=2,3j=2,3）：
    ∂K11∂Rij=0(当 j≠1).\frac{\partial K_{11}}{\partial R_{ij}} = 0 \quad (\text{当 } j \neq 1).∂Rij​∂K11​​=0(当 j=1).

2. 当 p=1,q=2p=1, q=2p=1,q=2（非对角线元素 K12K_{12}K12​）

K12=ab+de+gh.K_{12} = ab + de + gh.K12​=ab+de+gh.

  • 对 Ri1R_{i1}Ri1​ 求导（j=p=1j=p=1j=p=1，且 p≠qp \neq qp=q）：
    ∂K12∂Ri1=Ri2⇒{∂K12∂a=b,∂K12∂d=e,∂K12∂g=h.\frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial R_{i1}} = R_{i2} \quad \Rightarrow \quad \begin{cases} \frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial a} = b, \\ \frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial d} = e, \\ \frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial g} = h. \end{cases}∂Ri1​∂K12​​=Ri2​⇒⎩⎨⎧​∂a∂K12​​=b,∂d∂K12​​=e,∂g∂K12​​=h.​
  • 对 Ri2R_{i2}Ri2​ 求导（j=q=2j=q=2j=q=2，且 p≠qp \neq qp=q）：
    ∂K12∂Ri2=Ri1⇒{∂K12∂b=a,∂K12∂e=d,∂K12∂h=g.\frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial R_{i2}} = R_{i1} \quad \Rightarrow \quad \begin{cases} \frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial b} = a, \\ \frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial e} = d, \\ \frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial h} = g. \end{cases}∂Ri2​∂K12​​=Ri1​⇒⎩⎨⎧​∂b∂K12​​=a,∂e∂K12​​=d,∂h∂K12​​=g.​
  • 对其他列（如 j=3j=3j=3）：
    ∂K12∂Ri3=0.\frac{\partial K_{12}}{\partial R_{i3}} = 0.∂Ri3​∂K12​​=0.

3. 当 p=2,q=3p=2, q=3p=2,q=3（非对角线元素 K23K_{23}K23​）

K23=bc+ef+hi.K_{23} = bc + ef + hi.K23​=bc+ef+hi.

  • 对 Ri2R_{i2}Ri2​ 求导（j=p=2j=p=2j=p=2，且 p≠qp \neq qp=q）：
    ∂K23∂Ri2=Ri3⇒{∂K23∂b=c,∂K23∂e=f,∂K23∂h=i.\frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial R_{i2}} = R_{i3} \quad \Rightarrow \quad \begin{cases} \frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial b} = c, \\ \frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial e} = f, \\ \frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial h} = i. \end{cases}∂Ri2​∂K23​​=Ri3​⇒⎩⎨⎧​∂b∂K23​​=c,∂e∂K23​​=f,∂h∂K23​​=i.​
  • 对 Ri3R_{i3}Ri3​ 求导（j=q=3j=q=3j=q=3，且 p≠qp \neq qp=q）：
    ∂K23∂Ri3=Ri2⇒{∂K23∂c=b,∂K23∂f=e,∂K23∂i=h.\frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial R_{i3}} = R_{i2} \quad \Rightarrow \quad \begin{cases} \frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial c} = b, \\ \frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial f} = e, \\ \frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial i} = h. \end{cases}∂Ri3​∂K23​​=Ri2​⇒⎩⎨⎧​∂c∂K23​​=b,∂f∂K23​​=e,∂i∂K23​​=h.​
  • 对其他列（如 j=1j=1j=1）：
    ∂K23∂Ri1=0.\frac{\partial K_{23}}{\partial R_{i1}} = 0.∂Ri1​∂K23​​=0.

梯度张量表示

梯度张量 ∂K∂R∈R(3×3)×(3×3)\frac{\partial \mathbf{K}}{\partial \mathbf{R}} \in \mathbb{R}^{(3 \times 3) \times (3 \times 3)}∂R∂K​∈R(3×3)×(3×3) 的每个元素对应 ∂Kpq∂Rij\frac{\partial K_{pq}}{\partial R_{ij}}∂Rij​∂Kpq​​。部分结果如下：

KpqK_{pq}Kpq​ ∂Kpq∂R\frac{\partial K_{pq}}{\partial \mathbf{R}}∂R∂Kpq​​ 的梯度矩阵（3×33 \times 33×3）
K11K_{11}K11​ [2a002d002g00]\begin{bmatrix} 2a & 0 & 0 \\ 2d & 0 & 0 \\ 2g & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}​2a2d2g​000​000​​
K12K_{12}K12​ [ba0ed0hg0]\begin{bmatrix} b & a & 0 \\ e & d & 0 \\ h & g & 0 \end{bmatrix}​beh​adg​000​​
K23K_{23}K23​ [0cb0fe0ih]\begin{bmatrix} 0 & c & b \\ 0 & f & e \\ 0 & i & h \end{bmatrix}​000​cfi​beh​​
K33K_{33}K33​ [002c002f002i]\begin{bmatrix} 0 & 0 & 2c \\ 0 & 0 & 2f \\ 0 & 0 & 2i \end{bmatrix}​000​000​2c2f2i​​

总结

  1. 对角线元素 KppK_{pp}Kpp​：

    • 梯度仅在第 ppp 列非零，且为对应元素的 2 倍。
    • 例如，K33K_{33}K33​ 的梯度矩阵中，只有第 3 列有非零值。

  2. 非对角线元素 KpqK_{pq}Kpq​：

    • 梯度矩阵在第 ppp 列和第 qqq 列非零。
    • 第 ppp 列的导数是 R\mathbf{R}R 的第 qqq 列元素，第 qqq 列的导数是 R\mathbf{R}R 的第 ppp 列元素。

  3. 四维张量结构：

    • 每个 KpqK_{pq}Kpq​ 对应一个 3×33 \times 33×3 的梯度矩阵。
    • 总维度为 (3×3)×(3×3)(3 \times 3) \times (3 \times 3)(3×3)×(3×3)，共 81 个元素。

4. Backpropagation and Automatic Differentiation

4.1 典型分类器（Classifier）

1. 输入/输出对 (x(i),y(i))(x^{(i)}, y^{(i)})(x(i),y(i))

  • 输入 (x(i))(x^{(i)})(x(i))：表示第 iii 个样本的特征向量，例如 [x1,x2,...,xn][x_1, x_2, ..., x_n][x1​,x2​,...,xn​]。每个 xjx_jxj​ 是样本的一个特征。
    • 举例：在图像分类中，xjx_jxj​ 可以是像素值。
  • 输出 (y(i))(y^{(i)})(y(i))：表示第 iii 个样本的真实类别标签。
    • 举例：在二分类问题中，y(i)y^{(i)}y(i) 可能是 000（负类）或 111（正类）。

2. 特征表示（Feature Representation）

  • 定义：对输入数据进行特征化，形成一个特征向量 [x1,x2,...,xn][x_1, x_2, ..., x_n][x1​,x2​,...,xn​]，用于表示样本 x(i)x^{(i)}x(i) 的属性。
  • 形式：
    • xjx_jxj​：直接使用的第 jjj 个特征值。
    • fj(x)f_j(x)fj​(x)：有时会用函数 fj(x)f_j(x)fj​(x) 对特征进行变换（如归一化、标准化或特征提取）。

3. 分类函数（Classification Function）

  • 定义：根据输入特征 x(i)x^{(i)}x(i)，计算预测类别 y^\hat{y}y^​。
  • 形式：
    • p(y∣x)p(y|x)p(y∣x)：表示给定输入 xxx，预测类别 yyy 的概率。
    • 常用函数：
      • Sigmoid 函数：用于二分类问题，将输出映射到 [0,1][0, 1][0,1] 的概率范围。
      • Softmax 函数：用于多分类问题，输出每个类别的概率分布。

4. 目标函数（Objective Function）

  • 定义：用于衡量模型预测值 y^\hat{y}y^​ 与真实值 y(i)y^{(i)}y(i) 的差距，即损失函数（Loss Function）。
  • 常用目标函数：
    • 交叉熵损失（Cross-Entropy Loss）：常用于分类任务，特别是概率输出的模型。
      • 二分类交叉熵公式：
        Loss=−1N∑i=1N[y(i)log⁡(y^(i))+(1−y(i))log⁡(1−y^(i))]\text{Loss} = -\frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \left[ y^{(i)} \log(\hat{y}^{(i)}) + (1 - y^{(i)}) \log(1 - \hat{y}^{(i)}) \right]Loss=−N1​i=1∑N​[y(i)log(y^​(i))+(1−y(i))log(1−y^​(i))]

5. 优化算法（Optimization Algorithm）

  • 定义：通过优化算法最小化目标函数，从而找到最佳模型参数。
  • 常用方法：
    • 梯度下降（Gradient Descent）：通过计算损失函数相对于参数的梯度，沿反梯度方向调整参数，逐步逼近最优解。
    • 更新公式：
      wnew=wold−η⋅∇wLossw_{\text{new}} = w_{\text{old}} - \eta \cdot \nabla_w \text{Loss}wnew​=wold​−η⋅∇w​Loss
      • www：模型参数
      • η\etaη：学习率（步长）

4.2 A Recipe for Machine Learning

1. Given Training Data

{xi,yi}i=1N\{x_i, y_i\}_{i=1}^N{xi​,yi​}i=1N​

  • Input: A dataset consisting of NNN samples.
    • xix_ixi​: The input features for the iii-th sample.
    • yiy_iyi​: The corresponding label or target value for the iii-th sample.

The goal is to use this dataset to train a model that can predict yiy_iyi​ given xix_ixi​.

2. Choose Components

Two key components must be defined for the machine learning model:

a. Decision Function

y^=fθ(xi)\hat{y} = f_\theta(x_i)y^​=fθ​(xi​)

  • fθ(xi)f_\theta(x_i)fθ​(xi​): The model (or hypothesis function) parameterized by θ\thetaθ, which maps input xix_ixi​ to a predicted output y^\hat{y}y^​.
  • Example:
    • For a linear model: fθ(xi)=θTxif_\theta(x_i) = \theta^T x_ifθ​(xi​)=θTxi​.
    • For a neural network: fθ(xi)f_\theta(x_i)fθ​(xi​) could involve multiple layers and non-linear transformations.
b. Loss Function

ℓ(y^,yi)∈R\ell(\hat{y}, y_i) \in \mathbb{R}ℓ(y^​,yi​)∈R

  • The loss function measures the difference between the predicted value y^\hat{y}y^​ and the true value yiy_iyi​.
  • Example:
    • For regression: Mean Squared Error (MSE): ℓ(y^,yi)=(y^−yi)2\ell(\hat{y}, y_i) = (\hat{y} - y_i)^2ℓ(y^​,yi​)=(y^​−yi​)2.
    • For classification: Cross-Entropy Loss.

3. Define the Goal

θ∗=arg⁡min⁡θ∑i=1Nℓ(fθ(xi),yi)\theta^* = \arg \min_\theta \sum_{i=1}^N \ell(f_\theta(x_i), y_i)θ∗=argθmin​i=1∑N​ℓ(fθ​(xi​),yi​)

  • Objective: Minimize the total loss across all training samples by finding the optimal parameters θ∗\theta^*θ∗.
  • The goal is to adjust θ\thetaθ such that the predictions fθ(xi)f_\theta(x_i)fθ​(xi​) are as close as possible to the true labels yiy_iyi​.

4. Train with Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD)

θ(t+1)=θ(t)−η∇θℓ(fθ(xi),yi)\theta^{(t+1)} = \theta^{(t)} - \eta \nabla_\theta \ell(f_\theta(x_i), y_i)θ(t+1)=θ(t)−η∇θ​ℓ(fθ​(xi​),yi​)

  • Gradient Descent: Iteratively update the parameters θ\thetaθ by moving in the direction opposite to the gradient of the loss function.
    • ∇θℓ(fθ(xi),yi)\nabla_\theta \ell(f_\theta(x_i), y_i)∇θ​ℓ(fθ​(xi​),yi​): The gradient of the loss function with respect to θ\thetaθ.
    • η\etaη: The learning rate, which controls the step size of each update.
  • Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD): Updates θ\thetaθ using one sample (or a small batch) at a time, rather than the entire dataset.

4.3 Linear regression

It does not directly handle categorical outputs, which are required for classification tasks.
In machine learning, σ(a)\sigma(a)σ(a) is often used to represent an activation function . An activation function is a mathematical transformation applied to the output of a model (or neuron in neural networks). Its purpose is to introduce non-linearity to the model.

  • If σ(a)\sigma(a)σ(a) is a non-linear function (e.g., sigmoid, ReLU, tanh), the model becomes non-linear because the output is no longer a simple linear combination of the inputs.
  • If σ(a)=a\sigma(a) = aσ(a)=a, this means that the activation function is the identity function, i.e., it doesn't change the value of aaa. This keeps the model linear.

If σ(a)\sigma(a)σ(a) is a non-linear function, such as:

  • Sigmoid: σ(a)=11+e−a\sigma(a) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-a}}σ(a)=1+e−a1​
  • ReLU: σ(a)=max⁡(0,a)\sigma(a) = \max(0, a)σ(a)=max(0,a)
  • Tanh: σ(a)=ea−e−aea+e−a\sigma(a) = \frac{e^a - e^{-a}}{e^a + e^{-a}}σ(a)=ea+e−aea−e−a​

4.4 Logistic Regression

4.5 Backpropagation

This image explains the Backpropagation Algorithm, which is primarily used to calculate gradients for optimizing model parameters (e.g., weights θ\thetaθ). It is a crucial part of deep learning, especially when training neural networks. Below is a detailed explanation of the content in the image:

1. Structure of the Diagram

  • Top-left part: Shows a simple neural network structure where the output is yyy, and the inputs are x1,x2,x3,…,xMx_1, x_2, x_3, \dots, x_Mx1​,x2​,x3​,…,xM​. Each input has a corresponding weight θ1,θ2,θ3,…,θM\theta_1, \theta_2, \theta_3, \dots, \theta_Mθ1​,θ2​,θ3​,…,θM​.
  • Bottom-right part: Divided into two sections:
    • Forward: Computes the output yyy and the loss function JJJ.
    • Backward: Computes gradients ∂J∂θj\frac{\partial J}{\partial \theta_j}∂θj​∂J​ and ∂J∂xj\frac{\partial J}{\partial x_j}∂xj​∂J​, which are used to update the parameters.

2. Forward Propagation

In forward propagation, the following calculations are performed:

  1. Activation Value aaa:
    a=∑j=0Dθjxja = \sum_{j=0}^D \theta_j x_ja=j=0∑D​θj​xj​
    This is the weighted sum of the input features xjx_jxj​ and their corresponding weights θj\theta_jθj​.

  2. Output yyy:
    Using the sigmoid activation function:
    y=11+exp⁡(−a)y = \frac{1}{1 + \exp(-a)}y=1+exp(−a)1​
    The sigmoid function maps aaa to the range [0,1][0, 1][0,1], which is commonly used for binary classification tasks to predict probabilities.

  3. Loss Function JJJ:
    Using the cross-entropy loss function:
    J=y∗log⁡(y)+(1−y∗)log⁡(1−y)J = y^* \log(y) + (1 - y^*) \log(1 - y)J=y∗log(y)+(1−y∗)log(1−y)

    • y∗y^*y∗ is the true label (target value).
    • yyy is the model's predicted output.
    • This function measures the difference between the predicted value yyy and the true label y∗y^*y∗, serving as the objective to minimize during optimization.

3. Backward Propagation

The purpose of backpropagation is to compute the gradients of the loss function JJJ with respect to the parameters (e.g., θj\theta_jθj​ and xjx_jxj​) for updating the model. The key steps are as follows:
先通过通过链式法则（Chain Rule），计算损失函数对每个权重的偏导数（梯度）。

  • 首先计算损失对输出的梯度。
  • 然后逐层向后传播，计算每一层的梯度。

再使用梯度下降法，根据计算出的梯度调整权重和偏置。
公式：
Wnew=Wold−η⋅∂Loss∂WW_{\text{new}} = W_{\text{old}} - \eta \cdot \frac{\partial \text{Loss}}{\partial W}Wnew​=Wold​−η⋅∂W∂Loss​
其中：

  • WnewW_{\text{new}}Wnew​：更新后的权重
  • η\etaη：学习率（控制更新步长）
  • ∂Loss∂W\frac{\partial \text{Loss}}{\partial W}∂W∂Loss​：损失对权重的梯度

(1) Gradient of Loss with Respect to Output ∂J∂y\frac{\partial J}{\partial y}∂y∂J​:
∂J∂y=y∗y+1−y∗y−1\frac{\partial J}{\partial y} = \frac{y^*}{y} + \frac{1 - y^*}{y - 1}∂y∂J​=yy∗​+y−11−y∗​
This step computes how the loss function JJJ changes with respect to the model's output yyy.

(2) Gradient of Output with Respect to Activation ∂y∂a\frac{\partial y}{\partial a}∂a∂y​:
The derivative of the sigmoid function is:
∂y∂a=exp⁡(−a)(exp⁡(−a)+1)2\frac{\partial y}{\partial a} = \frac{\exp(-a)}{(\exp(-a) + 1)^2}∂a∂y​=(exp(−a)+1)2exp(−a)​
This step computes how the model's output yyy changes with respect to the activation value aaa.

(3) Gradient of Loss with Respect to Activation ∂J∂a\frac{\partial J}{\partial a}∂a∂J​:
Using the chain rule:
∂J∂a=∂J∂y⋅∂y∂a\frac{\partial J}{\partial a} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial y} \cdot \frac{\partial y}{\partial a}∂a∂J​=∂y∂J​⋅∂a∂y​
Combining the results from the previous two steps gives the gradient of the loss function with respect to the activation value aaa.

(4) Gradient of Loss with Respect to Weights ∂J∂θj\frac{\partial J}{\partial \theta_j}∂θj​∂J​:
Using the chain rule:
∂J∂θj=∂J∂a⋅∂a∂θj\frac{\partial J}{\partial \theta_j} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial a} \cdot \frac{\partial a}{\partial \theta_j}∂θj​∂J​=∂a∂J​⋅∂θj​∂a​
Since a=∑j=0Dθjxja = \sum_{j=0}^D \theta_j x_ja=∑j=0D​θj​xj​, we have:
∂a∂θj=xj\frac{\partial a}{\partial \theta_j} = x_j∂θj​∂a​=xj​
Thus:
∂J∂θj=∂J∂a⋅xj\frac{\partial J}{\partial \theta_j} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial a} \cdot x_j∂θj​∂J​=∂a∂J​⋅xj​

(5) Gradient of Loss with Respect to Inputs ∂J∂xj\frac{\partial J}{\partial x_j}∂xj​∂J​:
Similarly, using the chain rule:
∂J∂xj=∂J∂a⋅∂a∂xj\frac{\partial J}{\partial x_j} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial a} \cdot \frac{\partial a}{\partial x_j}∂xj​∂J​=∂a∂J​⋅∂xj​∂a​
Since a=∑j=0Dθjxja = \sum_{j=0}^D \theta_j x_ja=∑j=0D​θj​xj​, we have:
∂a∂xj=θj\frac{\partial a}{\partial x_j} = \theta_j∂xj​∂a​=θj​
Thus:
∂J∂xj=∂J∂a⋅θj\frac{\partial J}{\partial x_j} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial a} \cdot \theta_j∂xj​∂J​=∂a∂J​⋅θj​

4. Summary

This diagram illustrates the complete process of backpropagation:

  • Forward Propagation: Computes the output yyy and the loss JJJ.
  • Backward Propagation: Uses the chain rule to compute gradients, including ∂J∂θj\frac{\partial J}{\partial \theta_j}∂θj​∂J​ and ∂J∂xj\frac{\partial J}{\partial x_j}∂xj​∂J​.

These gradients are then used to update the model parameters (e.g., weights θj\theta_jθj​) to minimize the loss function JJJ. This is the core of training a neural network.

单变量求导

Problem 5: Rational and Exponential Functions

Find the derivative of:
f(x)=ex2+11+x4f(x) = \frac{e^{x^2 + 1}}{\sqrt{1 + x^4}}f(x)=1+x4​ex2+1​

Solution:

Using the quotient rule:
f′(x)=ddx[ex2+1]⋅1+x4−ex2+1⋅ddx[1+x4](1+x4)f'(x) = \frac{\frac{d}{dx}[e^{x^2 + 1}] \cdot \sqrt{1 + x^4} - e^{x^2 + 1} \cdot \frac{d}{dx}[\sqrt{1 + x^4}]}{(1 + x^4)}f′(x)=(1+x4)dxd​[ex2+1]⋅1+x4​−ex2+1⋅dxd​[1+x4​]​

Substitute the derivatives into the quotient rule:
f′(x)=(2xex2+1)1+x4−ex2+1⋅4x321+x41+x4f'(x) = \frac{(2x e^{x^2 + 1}) \sqrt{1 + x^4} - e^{x^2 + 1} \cdot \frac{4x^3}{2\sqrt{1 + x^4}}}{1 + x^4}f′(x)=1+x4(2xex2+1)1+x4​−ex2+1⋅21+x4​4x3​​

Simplify:
f′(x)=2xex2+11+x4−2x3ex2+1/1+x41+x4f'(x) = \frac{2x e^{x^2 + 1} \sqrt{1 + x^4} - 2x^3 e^{x^2 + 1} / \sqrt{1 + x^4}}{1 + x^4}f′(x)=1+x42xex2+11+x4​−2x3ex2+1/1+x4​​

Factor out 2xex2+12x e^{x^2 + 1}2xex2+1:
f′(x)=2xex2+1(1+x4−x21+x4)1+x4f'(x) = \frac{2x e^{x^2 + 1} \left(\sqrt{1 + x^4} - \frac{x^2}{\sqrt{1 + x^4}}\right)}{1 + x^4}f′(x)=1+x42xex2+1(1+x4​−1+x4​x2​)​

Simplify further if needed:
f′(x)=2xex2+1⋅1+x4−x21+x41+x4f'(x) = \frac{2x e^{x^2 + 1} \cdot \frac{1 + x^4 - x^2}{\sqrt{1 + x^4}}}{1 + x^4}f′(x)=1+x42xex2+1⋅1+x4​1+x4−x2​​
f′(x)=2xex2+1⋅(1+x2)(1−x2)1+x41+x4f'(x) = \frac{2x e^{x^2 + 1} \cdot \frac{(1 + x^2)(1 - x^2)}{\sqrt{1 + x^4}}}{1 + x^4}f′(x)=1+x42xex2+1⋅1+x4​(1+x2)(1−x2)​​

多变量

Example: Partial Derivatives of a Function

Given the function:

f(x,y)=(x+2y3)2f(x, y) = (x + 2y^3)^2f(x,y)=(x+2y3)2

Final Results:

∂f(x,y)∂x=2(x+2y3)\frac{\partial f(x, y)}{\partial x} = 2(x + 2y^3)∂x∂f(x,y)​=2(x+2y3)

∂f(x,y)∂y=12(x+2y3)y2\frac{\partial f(x, y)}{\partial y} = 12(x + 2y^3)y^2∂y∂f(x,y)​=12(x+2y3)y2

在例子中，函数 f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x) 被定义为：

f(x)=(x12+x2x1x2sin⁡(x1)),x=(x1x2)f(\mathbf{x}) = \begin{pmatrix} x_1^2 + x_2 \\ x_1 x_2 \\ \sin(x_1) \end{pmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{x} = \begin{pmatrix} x_1 \\ x_2 \end{pmatrix}f(x)=​x12​+x2​x1​x2​sin(x1​)​​,x=(x1​x2​​)

我们需要对 f(x)f(\mathbf{x})f(x) 的每个分量分别对 x2x_2x2​ 求偏导。现在重点分析第三个分量 sin⁡(x1)\sin(x_1)sin(x1​) 对 x2x_2x2​ 的偏导数。

第三个分量 sin⁡(x1)\sin(x_1)sin(x1​) 的偏导分析

  • sin⁡(x1)\sin(x_1)sin(x1​) 是一个关于 x1x_1x1​ 的函数，它完全独立于 x2x_2x2​，即它不包含 x2x_2x2​。
  • 因为 sin⁡(x1)\sin(x_1)sin(x1​) 中没有 x2x_2x2​，所以对 x2x_2x2​ 求偏导时，结果为 0。

数学表达：
∂∂x2sin⁡(x1)=0\frac{\partial}{\partial x_2} \sin(x_1) = 0∂x2​∂​sin(x1​)=0

为什么偏导为 0？

偏导数表示一个变量的变化如何影响函数值。在 sin⁡(x1)\sin(x_1)sin(x1​) 中，x2x_2x2​ 不会对函数值产生任何影响，因为它根本没有出现在函数中。因此，对 x2x_2x2​ 求偏导的结果就是 0。

总结

在例子中，函数的第三个分量是 sin⁡(x1)\sin(x_1)sin(x1​)，它只与 x1x_1x1​ 有关，与 x2x_2x2​ 无关。所以对 x2x_2x2​ 求偏导时，结果为 0。这就是为什么雅可比矩阵的第三行第二列是 0 的原因。
